titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: Wanda Catherine Blazejewski Larsen was extremely active in the Polish-American community in Delaware. She spent three summers studying at Polish universities in Krakow and Lublin to gain knowledge so she could inform the American public about Poland. To this end, she held many lectures and exhibits, and was a member of the Delaware Council of International Visitors and the Americans of Polish Descent Cultural Society. Mrs. Larsen was an active volunteer in Newark, Delaware, and Elkton, Maryland. Her autobiography is titled Dear and Not So Dear Memories.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Wanda Larsen, dating from 1940-1999. Much of the material relates to Larsen's travels to Poland and other destinations. These mainly consist of photographs and slides, but also include maps, brochures, and guidebooks. In addition, the collection includes 16 scrapbooks and photo albums which document her life, including her involvement with the Americans of Polish Descent Cultural Society and her ties with the University of Delaware. The scrapbooks contain photographs, awards, certificates, greeting cards, menus, programs, and magazine articles. The collection also includes drafts of her autobiography, Dear and Not So Dear Memories, and college papers of Larsen and of her husband, Louis.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/larsen.htm.
